page.title: 05ST.MARY'S CHURCH BURWELL.
page.content: Though it has a{Norman tower},the Parish Church is{a fine example of the {Perpendicular}style.It has 12 pillars supporting the roof.There are 8 bells on big wooden wheels.The nave is red- carpeted and there are two altars.(The smaller is for Wednesday Communion. ) Unlike most churches the organ is at the back and the organist goes up on a high balcony. The Vicar can use a microphone linked to two speakers on pillars. {Reverend Secrett}has been in Burwell for 10 years.He holds regular services on Sundays and Wednesdays using the Alternative Service Book 1980 with Hymns Ancient And Modern.There may be as many as 110 in the Sunday morning congregation including a{Sunday School of 50 children. A{Flaming Heart Tombstone}in the yard recalls an 18th C.barn-fire tragedy.
